content.description: From a random sample of potential voters in an upcoming election, 47% indicated they intended to vote for Candidate R. A 95 percent confidence interval was constructed from the sample, and the margin of error for the estimate was 5%.
content.question: Which of the following is the best interpretation of the interval?

choices.label: We are 95% confident that the proportion who intend to vote for Candidate R from the random sample is between 42% and 52%.
We are 95% confident that the proportion who intend to vote for Candidate R from the population is between 42% and 52%.
We are 95% confident that the proportion who intend to vote for Candidate R from the random sample is 47%.
We are 95% confident that the proportion who intend to vote for Candidate R from the population is 47%.
We are confident that 95% of the population intend to vote for Candidate R.

content.answer: We are 95% confident that the proportion who intend to vote for Candidate R from the population is between 42% and 52%.

topic.text: 6.3: Justifying a Claim Based on a Confidence Interval for a Population Proportion

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
